title: (x) Discovery Channel typeface - DIN, Gotham {Patty, Sydney F}
content:
Hi

can anyone tell me the name of the typeface on the discovery channel website

[http://www.discoverychannel.co.uk/\_home/index.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081647/http:/www.discoverychannel.co.uk/_home/index.shtml "http://www.discoverychannel.co.uk/\_home/index.shtml")

not the face of their logo but the one they use for tabs such as ON TV, VIDEO, FEATURES, INTERACTIVE etc.

I know its small but any ideas would be great.

Thanks guys

Jono
author: mrjono

comments.content:
It looks like Din Engschrift to me.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/din-1451/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081647/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/din-1451/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/din-1451/")

or Din Condensed

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081647/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/")

i think it is most likely the font Gotham

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100008](http://web.archive.org/web/20110507081647/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100008 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100008")

... well that's what happens when you dig up a thread that's 2 years old.

They've updated the site, thus changing the menu's typeface.
